article_title: Franklin Hospital experiences growing pains after emerging from a decade of stagnation
article_text:
What are CAHs?

According to the U.S. Department of Health and Human Services, Critical Access Hospitals must:

* Have no more than 25 inpatient beds,

* Maintain an annual average l...

article_metadata.description:
A shortage of certified coders and accounting staff is the cause of a backlog of $1.8 million in unfiled claims and outdated cost reports at Franklin Hospital, say hospital administrators.
But those are good problems to have, said CEO Hervey Davis, because both issues indicate an uptick in the hospital's revenue and a return to prosperity.
Revenues eked along in a span from 1997 to 2001, when the 60-year-old hospital was operated by Southern Illinois Healthcare (SIH), the not-for-profit
article_metadata.author: Kelsey Landis Staff writer
